column4: are ther docks for ubuntu, if so how can i set them on my sesktop
hello
can any body help me i dont knw how to set a dock on my ubuntu
and is there widgets like a clock etc that i can set on my desktop
kde has cute stuff like that built in
try kiba dock
aptitude install avant-window-navigator
ok
go to the Applications Menu, and click on "Add/Remove Software" or something like that
in there, you're going to make sure the dropdown on the top part of that program says "all free and open sources packages" or something like that
then you're going to put "avant-window-navigator" in the search box
from there on just double click and install.
that will give you the Mac Like dock

aptitude is a program you use in the console, with some parameters you search, install, remove packages. avant-window-navigator is a package. Under the console typing "aptitude install avant-window-navigator" you'll install that package.
I don't really know, I use my desktop pretty simple, with some minor gl effects :P
ok
i'll give you something to play with.
there's a package called simple-ccsm
install "simple-ccsm"
that will add a the compiz configuration settings manager under the System -- Preferences  menu
np, there's some really fun plugins there.
the trick is binding the right plugins on the right keys.
